intro: Mitrospora pallida, commonly known as the pale mitrospora, is a species of fungi that belongs to the family Pucciniaceae. It is characterized by its pale, powdery spore masses that are typically found on the surface of its host plants. This fungus is primarily a saprophyte, decomposing organic matter in forested environments. It has a limited host range, usually infecting members of the genus *Acer* (maple trees). Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, Mitrospora pallida is considered a rare and less-studied organism in the field of mycology.
